Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: From a quick scan, 'Verify Documents' and 'Call Customer' appear more than once in some cases. ... So, I'll focus on 'Verify Documents' and 'Call Customer' since they're repeated in multiple cases.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In case C001, it appears twice. The first time is right after the request is initiated, and the activity is performed by a BackOfficeAgent. The description says they're checking identity documents. Then, after the customer submits additional documents, there's another 'Verify Documents' activity by the same role. So, it seems like the first verification is an initial check, and the second is a re-check after additional information is provided.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In case C002, 'Verify Documents' appears only once, for identity verification. In case C003, it appears twice: first for physical verification of ID at the branch, and then again after an account adjustment.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So, for 'Verify Documents,' the context seems to be related to what's being verified and perhaps the stage in the process. Maybe I can prefix these with the stage or the type of document being verified.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For 'Call Customer,' it also appears multiple times in some cases. In C001, it's to request missing docs; in C002, it's to clarify an account discrepancy and then to confirm adjustments; in C003, it's to have the customer return to the branch.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Here, the purpose of the call varies significantly across cases and even within the same case. So, I need to find a way to capture the reason for the call each time.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Perhaps I can incorporate the reason or the outcome of the call into the activity name. For example, 'Call for Missing Docs,' 'Call to Clarify Discrepancy,' etc.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Similarly, 'Adjust Account' appears in C002 and C003. In C002, it's to adjust account details internally after a call, and in C003, it's for internal correction due to missing information.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Maybe I can specify the reason for the adjustment in the activity name.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Alright, let's proceed step by step for each case.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For Case C001, I renamed 'Verify Documents' to 'Initial Document Verification' and 'Re-verify Documents' to distinguish between the first and second checks of the documents.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For Case C002, I renamed 'Call to Clarify Discrepancy' and 'Call to Confirm Adjustments' to clearly indicate the purpose of each call based on their corresponding context.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For Case C003, I renamed 'Call to Request Return to Branch' and 'Post-Adjustment Document Verification' to reflect the reason for the call and the sequencing after an account adjustment.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: By renaming the activities in this way, we provide a clearer understanding of what each step entails and its significance in the overall process.
